meanings.definition: A competition in which participants spell words aloud
meanings.sent1: During the spelldown, the students took turns spelling words.
meanings.sent2: The annual spelldown at the school was intense and exciting.
meanings.sent3: In the spelldown, even the teachers joined to test their spelling skills.
meanings.sent4: The final round of the spelldown felt like a battle of wits.
meanings.sent5: The champion of the spelldown proudly held up the trophy.

meanings.definition: To compete in a spelling competition
meanings.sent1: She decided to spelldown to showcase her spelling abilities.
meanings.sent2: Students from different schools will spelldown next week.
meanings.sent3: I will spelldown against my best friend in the competition.
meanings.sent4: The siblings always spelldown to see who is the better speller.
meanings.sent5: He practiced hard to spelldown and win the spelling bee.

meanings.definition: The act of spelling words aloud in a competition
meanings.sent1: Her accurate spelling in the spelldown impressed the judges.
meanings.sent2: The audience cheered loudly during the intense spelldown.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected twist in the spelldown made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable during the final spelldown.
meanings.sent5: The students prepared diligently for the upcoming spelldown.
